article_text:
President Obama and fellow Democrats have been obsessed with the African-American electorate of late, mindful that the party needs high black voter turnout Tuesday to keep the Senate. The implication is that every black American who votes will automatically pull the Democratic lever, and perhaps they will. What is becoming harder to explain is why black Americans would feel any gratitude for the results of Obama Administration policies.

...

twitter.description: The appeals to racial division mask the lack of economic progress, the Wall Street Journal writes in an editorial.
twitter.title: Obama and the Black Vote

og.description: The appeals to racial division mask the lack of economic progress, the Wall Street Journal writes in an editorial.
og.title: Obama and the Black Vote

article_summary:
What is becoming harder to explain is why black Americans would feel any gratitude for the results of Obama Administration policies.
President Obama and fellow Democrats have been obsessed with the African-American electorate of late, mindful that the party needs high black voter turnout Tuesday to keep the Senate.
The implication is that every black American who votes will automatically pull the Democratic lever, and perhaps they will.
